body_html:
This didn't work for me. It claimed to install, and the first test worked, but when I tried to do the convolutional MNIST test at

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/get_started/os_setup.html#run-a-tensorflow-demo-model

I got:

E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_dnn.cc:346] Loaded cudnn library: 5103 but source was compiled against 4007.  If using a binary install, upgrade your cudnn library to match.  If building from sources, make sure the library loaded matches the version you specified during compile configuration.
F tensorflow/core/kernels/conv_ops.cc:459] Check failed: stream->parent()->GetConvolveAlgorithms(&algorithms)

I also tried building from source, which got me to exactly the same point. I'm now caught in a bind:

  1. When I built from source, I definitely specified cuDNN 5.1.3, and that's what I installed, but the source (of what?) "was compiled against 4007".

  2. When I tried to use the binary as tim-scharf suggested, I got the same problem. I can't downgrade cuDNN to version 4, because THAT installation requires downgrading from CUDA 7.5 to 7.0, and I can't figure out how to do that.

Any suggestions would be appreciated.

Any suggestions would be appreciated.
body:
This didn't work for me. It claimed to install, and the first test worked, but when I tried to do the convolutional MNIST test at

https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/get_started/os_setup.html#run-a-tensorflow-demo-model

I got:

```
E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_dnn.cc:346] Loaded cudnn library: 5103 but source was compiled against 4007.  If using a binary install, upgrade your cudnn library to match.  If building from sources, make sure the library loaded matches the version you specified during compile configuration.
F tensorflow/core/kernels/conv_ops.cc:459] Check failed: stream->parent()->GetConvolveAlgorithms(&algorithms) 
```

I also tried building from source, which got me to exactly the same point. I'm now caught in a bind:

1) When I built from source, I definitely specified cuDNN 5.1.3, and that's what I installed, but the source (of what?) "was compiled against 4007".

2) When I tried to use the binary as tim-scharf suggested, I got the same problem. I can't downgrade cuDNN to version 4, because THAT installation requires downgrading from CUDA 7.5 to 7.0, and I can't figure out how to do that.

Any suggestions would be appreciated.
